meanings.definition: A group of immunosuppressant drugs used to prevent organ rejection in transplant patients.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed cyclosporines to help my body accept the new kidney.
meanings.sent2: Transplant patients often take cyclosporines to avoid rejecting the donated organ.
meanings.sent3: I joked that the cyclosporines were like bouncers at a club, keeping my immune system in check.
meanings.sent4: The cyclosporines acted like bodyguards, protecting the transplanted organ from attack.
meanings.sent5: Taking the cyclosporines was like putting up a shield around my new kidney.

meanings.definition: Any of various cyclic oligopeptides with immunosuppressive activity.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are studying different cyclosporines for their effects on the immune system.
meanings.sent2: The patient was prescribed a specific cyclosporine to help manage their autoimmune condition.
meanings.sent3: The cyclosporines were like secret agents, quietly working to calm down the immune response.
meanings.sent4: Her body welcomed the cyclosporines like peaceful negotiators in a tense situation.
meanings.sent5: The cyclosporines danced with the immune system, keeping it from causing harm.
